main event: Multiple witnesses observed an unidentified flying object near Craig, Montana, on January 9, 1953.
interesting points: The object was described as saucer-shaped with glowing lights and estimated to be 25 to 40 feet long,The object first appeared to be stationary before rapidly accelerating and disappearing,Investigators considered the witnesses to be mature and reliable,One witness claimed to estimate the speed of the object at 5600 miles per hour,The incident was classified as 'unknown' due to lack of physical evidence.
witness description: Various individuals including a mature sales manager and a child were among the witnesses.
